hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major policy speech, CPI release), a sharp, high-volume spike in BTC volatility (1-min ATR > 5x 15-min rolling average) that fails to sustain for more than 15 minutes and is followed by a 30-minute period of declining volume and compressed price range (< 50% of the spike range) will lead to a mean-reverting move in the opposite direction of the initial spike over the next 2-4 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news often triggers knee-jerk, liquidity-driven moves by algos and emotional traders. If the move lacks follow-through (declining volume, compression), it suggests the initial reaction may have been overdone. The subsequent break of the compression range often traps late momentum traders and triggers a reversal as initial positions are unwound.
entry_conditions: High-impact news event identified via news sentiment API (score > 0.7 on event scale)
BTC 1-min ATR spikes to > 5x its 15-min rolling average within 15 mins of event
Spike fails to sustain: price returns within 50% of pre-spike range within 15 mins
Subsequent 30-min period shows declining volume (each 5-min bar lower than previous) and price range compression (range < 50% of initial spike range)
Enter on a break of the high/low of the 30-minute compression candle, in the direction OPPOSITE the initial news spike.

exit_conditions.take_profit: 1.5x the ATR of the initial volatility spike
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 0.75x the ATR of the initial volatility spike (on the side of the initial spike)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The reversal move fails to reach 1x the initial spike ATR before hitting the stop loss in more than 55% of qualifying events, or the initial spike continues its trend >70% of the time instead of reversing.
